Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2013 07:01PM LindaJD wrote: Hotpinkmess,  I was just diagnosed the end of Feb.  I had the routine mammo, then ultrasound, then the biopsy & then the MRI.  The results showed stage 1 , grade 1 & tumor about 1.7 cm.  I'm scheduled for surgery on April 3rd & am having a lumpectomy w/ a sentinel node biopsy.  My surgeon recommended radiation after the surgery.  Your diagnoses sounds similar to mine so thought I'd share what people have told me; that it was caught early.  The ladies on this site have been so helpful & supportive!  They have given me advice & tips that I never would have thought of!!  You have every right to be scared & nervous.  Take one step @ a time.  Ask questions & get all the info you can, so you are better informed.  Ask for copies of all your test results!  Try & keep busy.  That's what I have been doing.  Let us know how you are doing:)

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2013 03:39PM LindaJD wrote: Hi Ladies,  well my surgery is over & done with!   It will be a week tomorrow.  It was definitely a long day @ the hospital to say the least.  I had to have the 2 pre-op procedures done; first was Nuclear Medicine for TWO hours for the dye injection & then on to Radiology for the needle localization (OUCH!)  They would NOT let me use the numbing cream my Surgeon prescribed:(  My surgery was about 1 1/2 hrs, then Recovery.  I was nauseous as soon as I woke up so they gave me 2 doses of meds to calm my stomach.  I was discharged around 5:30pm.  Didn't sleep much that night.  Thursday morning, I felt okay but then I became nauseous again & started throwing up & running to the bathroom for the rest of the day.  Didn't eat for 2 days.  The bandages are off & I have steri strips & stitches for both incisions.  The Surgeon removed 3 lymph nodes & I'm still waiting for the results.  I haven't been able to sleep much cause I can not get comfortable.  I've tried to prop my arm up w/ a pillow & that helps a bit.  I LOVE my Flexibras; wear them all day & @ night too!!  So now I just have to be patient, rest & recover.

Posts.Content: Mar 8, 2013 08:15PM LindaJD wrote: Hi Bella,  I can sympathize w/ you.  I just got diagnosed less than 2 weeks ago.   I feel the same way you do; angry, in shock &  fear of the unknown.  I know when I wake up the first thing that comes to my mind is this is just a really bad dream but then reality slaps me in the face & I realize this is really happening to me.  If it makes you feel any better; you are not alone.  From what other women have wrote about on here, they say it does get easier.  They say to take one day @ a time, so that's what I've been doing.   They say we have to be strong!  To have faith & hope.  Maybe in time, we will be able to acquire those things. Take care.
